rComments: I'd actually rate Terry at more of a 4 (he does go on rants) but SOMEBODY'S got bring up his score; he's NOT that bad. He cares deeply about his students which is not something I see often w/econ teachers. I feel like most of us econ/bme majors are really just looking to get jobs & lead good lives after college; Terry wants that for us. Be nice!!

People give Terry less  credit than he deserves. He shows that he loves accounting and is passionate about what he teaches. If people don't fall asleep all of the time during class then they will be able to perform well in the class. I took him Winter 2016 and I would say that he is a kind hearted man who wishes for the best for his students.

He's lectures are hard to follow. He goes on rants about food all the time. He barely teaches whats on the test and does not show how to do problem just reads the slides.  Advice: Just really go over his study guide. You will have to learn everything yourself but if you do that you can get an A He also gives extra credit that helps a lot
You receive extra credit if you go to lecture, but the lecturer teaches you nothing.
Wonderful teacher! Understand the material and it will not be hard to receive a good grade!!!

By far the worst teacher I've ever had.  Spent one class period telling us all the different parts of a cow and the specific types of meat that come from each part, nothing in relation to Managerial Accounting.  Gives ppt lectures that don't even correlate with the required textbook.  Only way to pass is self-study; u should consider taking online

Terry is by far the WORST teacher I have ever had. He does not know his own due dates, homework assignments, etc. Rambles in-cohesively for hours and calls it a lecture and gives you the WRONG information when asking questions on the subject. Recycles the same material he used for dozens of other classes, and its usually not relevant to our book.
Literally the worst teacher I have ever had the misfortune of learning from. Avoid at all costs, mandatory attendance in a class that is so boring he seems ready to fall asleep.
